title: Have you read YA books that you have enjoyed as an adult? What were they? - Quora

response.answer_text: I have entire bookshelves full of YA books to recommend, but I’ll stick to a top five for brevity’s sake.  I’LL GIVE YOU THE SUN by Jandy Nelson (get tissues out and ready)FANGIRL by Rainbow RowellTHE RAVEN CYCLE by Maggie Stiefvater (cheating bc this is a series)THE HATE U GIVE by Angie Thomas — I especially suggest this if you are a teacher/student reading TO KILL A MOCKINGBIRD. Read THUG along with TKAM and then discuss the differing narratives, historical contexts, and systemic racism in the US from then to now.A MONSTER CALLS by Patrick Ness (tissues are also a good suggestion for this one)

I read The Inheritance Cycle by Christopher Paolini back when I was a youth, but I have since reread them and they are very good, if you’re into fantasy. Also, depends on what you call YA. The Harry Potter books are fantastic, and they’re technically children’s lit. The Lord of the Rings were written for children but they are adult fiction imo and are incredible of course.

Definitely. I enjoyed, Garth Nix’s Keys to the Kingdom series Cassandra Clare’s Mortal Instruments series Jonathan Stroud’s Bartimaeus Trilogy Michael Scott’s The Secrets of the Immortal Nicholas Flamel series John Marsden’s Tomorrow When the War Began series Suzanne Collins’ Hunger Games trilogy Lois Lowry’s The Giver Terry Pratchett’s Tiffany Aching books and his Johnny Maxwell books Terry Pratchett’s The Amazing Maurice and His Educated Rodents

I will happily read anything by Tamora Pierce. I enjoyed the Dark is Rising sequence by Susan Cooper. My Side of the Mountain by Jean Craighead George is always worth a re-read. And I still occasionally re-read my (ancient) Trixie Belden books. By the way, I am 63 years old, and my motto is: a good story is a good story is a good story…
I love YA books. Here are some I’ve read:
Anything by Rebecca Stead. Her books are like little puzzles, full of subtle complexities. Well worth reading for children, young adults, and adults alike.
